module.name: Clipbrd
module.short: Definitions for the Clipboard to hold Cut or Copied data for Pasting.

descr.p: clipbrd.pp contains classes, types, and routines used to implement TClipboard. TClipboard encapsulates the system clipboard for supported platforms. This file is part of the Lazarus Component Library (LCL).

element.name: CF_Text
element.short: Gets the pre-defined clipboard format used for plain text.

element.name: CF_Bitmap
element.short: Gets the pre-defined clipboard format used for bitmap images.

element.name: CF_Picture
element.short: Gets the pre-defined clipboard format used for the LCL Picture type.

element.name: CF_MetaFilePict
element.short: Gets the pre-defined clipboard format used for the LCL Meta-File Picture type.

element.name: CF_Object
element.short: Gets the pre-defined clipboard format used for the LCL Object type.

element.name: CF_Component
element.short: Gets the pre-defined clipboard format used for the LCL Component type.

element.name: CF_HTML
element.short: Gets the pre-defined clipboard format used for HTML content.

element.name: TClipboardData
element.short: Record type with the format identifier and data for cached clipboard content.

element.name: TClipboardData.FormatID
element.short: Clipboard format identifier.

element.name: TClipboardData.Stream
element.short: Stream with the content stored for the associated clipboard format.

element.name: TClipboard
element.short: TClipboard - area for holding information that has been cut or copied, ready for pasting.

descr.p: TClipboard - area for holding information that has been cut or copied, ready for pasting.

The clipboard object encapsulates the Windows clipboard and the three standard Gtk selections. For each of the three clipboards/selections there is an object: PrimarySelection, SecondarySelection and Clipboard. There is no difference between the three objects except their type.

A lot of information about Clipboard Formats, including predefined formats for Delphi/Kylix compatibility, is found in the LCLType unit, at TClipboardFormat, TClipboardType, ClipboardTypeName, TPredefinedClipboardFormat, PredefinedClipboardMimeTypes

element.name: TClipboard.AddFormat
element.short: Acquires ownership of the Clipboard and adds a format.

descr.p: If not already done, this function acquires ownership of the clipboard. Acquiring ownership clears the clipboard. If the format already exists, it replaces the old content. Otherwise, it is added. The format CF_TEXT is handled by AsText and SetTextBuf. Use those functions instead.

element.name: TClipboard.AddFormat.Result
element.short: True if format added correctly.

element.name: TClipboard.Assign
element.short: Copies properties from the specified persistent object to the clipboard.

descr.p: Assign is an overridden method in TClipboard used to copy properties from the persistent object in Source to the clipboard instance. It provides support for using TPicture and TGraphic types in Source, and calls private methods used to copy the properties specific to the class types. If Source is not one of these class types, the inherited method is called.

element.name: TClipboard.Assign.Source
element.short: Persistent object with the property values copied in the method.

element.name: TClipboard.AssignTo
element.short: Copies property values into the specified persistent object.

element.name: TClipboard.AssignTo.Dest
element.short: Persistent object where the properties in the class instance are stored.

element.name: TClipboard.Clear
element.short: Clear the clipboard.

element.name: TClipboard.Close
element.short: Close down the clipboard.

element.name: TClipboard.Create
element.short: Create - Constructor: make a new instance of a clipboard.

element.name: TClipboard.Create.AClipboardType
element.short: AClipboardType - optional argument specifying type of clipboard to be created.

element.name: TClipboard.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. It frees resources allocated in the class instance, and calls the inherited destructor prior to exiting from the method.

element.name: TClipboard.FindPictureFormatID
element.short: FindPictureFormatID - search for the first format ID that is a graphic.

element.name: TClipboard.FindPictureFormatID.Result
element.short: Returns a Clipboard format.

element.name: TClipboard.FindFormatID
element.short: FindFormatID - find a Format ID that has the specified name.

element.name: TClipboard.FindFormatID.Result
element.short: Returns a Clipboard format.

element.name: TClipboard.GetComponent
element.short: GetComponent - reads a component from the clipboard.

element.name: TClipboard.GetFormat
element.short: GetFormat - read information on format from the clipboard.

element.name: TClipboard.GetFormat.Result
element.short: True if Format found.

element.name: TClipboard.SupportedFormats
element.short: SupportedFormats - fills a stringlist with the names of the supported MIME types.

element.name: TClipboard.GetTextBuf
element.short: GetTextBuf - reads text from the clipboard and returns the number of characters.

element.name: TClipboard.GetTextBuf.Result
element.short: Number of characters in text buffer.

element.name: TClipboard.HasFormat
element.short: HasFormat - look up the list to see if the format is supported. If a TPicture format is specified, all graphic formats are searched.

element.name: TClipboard.HasFormat.Result
element.short: True if format is supported.

element.name: TClipboard.HasFormatName
element.short: HasFormatName - checks if data have format with specified name.

element.name: TClipboard.HasFormatName.Result
element.short: True if named format found.

element.name: TClipboard.HasPictureFormat
element.short: HasPictureFormat - checks whether data are formatted as a picture.

element.name: TClipboard.HasPictureFormat.Result
element.short: True if formatted as picture.

element.name: TClipboard.Open
element.short: Open the clipboard to receive and transmit data.

element.name: TClipboard.SetComponent
element.short: Write specified component to the Clipboard.

element.name: TClipboard.SetComponent.Component
element.short: Component stored in the clipboard.

element.name: TClipboard.SetComponentAsText
element.short: Stores the specified Component in the clipboard.

descr.p: SetComponentAsText is a Boolean function used to store the specified Component to the TClipboard instance.

SetComponentAsText calls the WriteComponentAsTextToStream routine in the lresources.pp unit to store Component to a TMemoryStream. The String value in the stream is assigned to the AsText property to store the value in the clipboard.

SetComponentAsText calls BeginUpdate prior to storing the component to the clipboard, and EndUpdate when the operation has been completed. The return value for the method is the value returned from EndUpdate.

element.name: TClipboard.SetComponentAsText.Component
element.short: Component instance stored to the clipboard in the method.

element.name: TClipboard.SetComponentAsText.Result
element.short: True when no other updates are pending for the clipboard, and its ownership has not changed.

element.name: TClipboard.SetFormat
element.short: Sets the clipboard format to the specified identifier and copies the value in Stream.

descr.p: SetFormat is a Boolean function used to select the clipboard format for the format identifier in FormatID, and load the content in Stream. It calls AddFormat to select the supported format in FormatID, and to cache values in Stream to its TClipboardData record instance.

SetFormat calls BeginUpdate prior to activating the format and loading its value. It calls EndUpdate when the operation has been completed. The value from EndUpdate is used as the return value for the method.
SetFormat is called when TGraphic or TPicture class instances are loaded to the clipboard in the Assign method.

element.name: TClipboard.SetFormat.FormatID
element.short: Format identifier needed for the specified stream.

element.name: TClipboard.SetFormat.Stream
element.short: Stream with the content loaded in the method.

element.name: TClipboard.SetSupportedFormats
element.short: SetSupportedFormats - set all supported formats at once.

descr.p: SetSupportedFormats sets all supported formats at once All data will be empty. This procedure is useful if setting the OnRequest event to put the data on the fly.
Example: Using the PrimarySelection from synedit.pp.

element.name: TClipboard.SetTextBuf
element.short: Loads the clipboard buffer using the text in the specified PChar value.

descr.p: SetTextBuf is a method used to load the text specified in Buffer into the clipboard. Buffer is a PChar type, and when not assigned (Nil), is set to #0 in the method. Its value is loaded in the TClipboardData instances used for the text clipboard format.

element.name: TClipboard.SetTextBuf.Buffer
element.short: PChar value loaded into the clipboard.

element.name: TClipboard.AsText
element.short: AsText - holds the textual data in the clipboard as a string.

element.name: TClipboard.SetAsHtml
element.short: Puts a HTML string on the clipboard.

descr.p: Puts a HTML string on the clipboard. On Windows it will automatically insert a ClipBoard Header. The procedure can also (optionally) set a provided plaintext representation of HTML on the ClipBoard.

element.name: TClipboard.SetAsHtml.HTML
element.short: The HTML string that shall be put on the ClipBoard.

element.name: TClipboard.SetAsHtml.PlainText
element.short: Optional plain text (string) representation of the HTML.
element.descr: The optional string parameter PlainText is meant to be a plain text representation of the HTML string. The user is responsible for the contents of this variable. The value of PlainText can later be retrieved via the AsText property. If PlainText is an empty string, no plain text is added to the ClipBoard, nor is the current plain text content of the ClipBoard cleared.

element.name: TClipboard.GetAsHtml
element.short: Retrieves the HTML content of the clipboard (if available).
element.descr: Retrieves the HTML content of the clipboard (if available). On Windows it will automatically remove the clipboard header that Windows inserts. The resulting HTML string will be UTF-8 encoded.

element.name: TClipboard.GetAsHtml.Result
element.short: The HTML content of the clipboard as a string. Empty string if the function fails.

element.name: TClipboard.ClipboardType
element.short: ClipboardType - ctPrimarySelection, ctSecondarySelection, ctClipboard.

element.name: TClipboard.FormatCount
element.short: FormatCount - the number of formats available.

element.name: TClipboard.Formats
element.short: Formats - the formats being used in the current clipboard.

descr.p: Formats - the formats being used in the current clipboard
You can read the formats with this property one by one. But this will result in many requests, which can be very slow (especially on terminals).
Better use "SupportedFormats".

element.name: TClipboard.OnRequest
element.short: OnRequest - event handler for a request for clipboard data.

descr.p: OnRequest - event handler for a request for clipboard data.
If the clipboard has the ownership, this event will be called each time data are requested from the clipboard by the application or another application.
There is one special case:
If the clipboard loses ownership the OnRequest event will be called with FormatID=0. This event will be erased on lost of ownership.
If the OnRequest event was already set before, the prior method will be called with FormatID=0 to be notified of the loss.

element.name: PrimarySelection
element.short: PrimarySelection - the first selection if multiple clipboards exist.

descr.p: The PrimarySelection is available on platforms like X. Normally when the user selects some text with the mouse the primary selection is set and when the user clicks the middle mouse button the text is copied to the mouse position. On platforms without multiple clipboards, the PrimarySelection still works in the LCL application, but does not communicate with other applications.

element.name: PrimarySelection.Result
element.short: Returns a variable of type TClipboard.

element.name: SecondarySelection
element.short: SecondarySelection - the second selection if multiple clipboards exist.

descr.p: The SecondarySelection is available on platforms like X. See PrimarySelection for more details. There is no standard how to use the secondary selection, so it is free to use. X supports a dozen more selections, but they are not supported by the LCL.

element.name: SecondarySelection.Result
element.short: Returns a variable of type TClipboard.

element.name: Clipboard
element.short: Clipboard the function called to access the clipboard with an optional type specifier.

descr.p: The Clipboard is available on most platforms and normally used by Copy/Paste.

element.name: Clipboard.Result
element.short: Returns a variable of type TClipboard.

element.name: Clipboard.ClipboardType
element.short: ClipboardType - optional argument to specify type of clipboard.

element.name: SetClipboard
element.short: SetClipboard - sets up and returns a NewClipboard, with an optional type specifier.

element.name: SetClipboard.Result
element.short: Returns a variable of type TClipboard.

element.name: SetClipboard.ClipboardType
element.short: ClipboardType - optional argument to specify type of clipboard.

element.name: SetClipboard.NewClipboard
element.short: NewClipboard - the new clipboard to be set up.

element.name: FreeAllClipboards
element.short: FreeAllClipboards - frees all existing clipboards, releasing their resources.

element.name: RegisterClipboardFormat
element.short: RegisterClipboardFormat add the supplied format name to the register of clipboard formats.

element.name: RegisterClipboardFormat.Result
element.short: Returns the registered clipboard format.

element.name: RegisterClipboardFormat.Format
element.short: The name of the required format as a string.

element.name: TClipboard.GetComponentAsText
element.short: GetComponentAsText - read the component as text, if supported.
